issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies `raisePressure(pressure: double): void`, but the reference solution’s `Pneumatic` interface (and its implementations) define `void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease)`. This parameter‐type mismatch will confuse students about whether to use `double` or `int` and will lead to signature errors against the provided solution/tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the parameter type of `raisePressure` across all artifacts. Either change the UML and problem description to `int pressureIncrease` or update the reference solution’s interface and implementations to accept `double` for the pressure parameter.

issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies the method signature raisePressure(pressure: double), but the solution implementation declares void raisePressure(int pressureIncrease). The parameter name and type differ from the UML, which can confuse students mapping the requirement to the code.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the implementation with the UML: change the signature to void raisePressure(double pressure), using the same parameter name and type as in the problem statement.
